fields.summary: Add Section Discussing How to Change Multicast Address for Group Membership

comments.body: Thanks [~hspencer]. This is fairly important because multicast issues seem to be biting us a lot in the field.

Hey [~kedwards],

I may be incorrect here, but changing the setup_membership.groovy had to be modified, along with the addition to CLOUD_OPTS, had to be done in order for the membership change to work (at least, this is what was communicated to me in EUCA-8371.  Is this not correct?

[~kedwards],

AH, ok.  Thanks. Makes sense.

[~neil], 

No problem.  Let me know if you need me to provide additional information.

Yep, agreed, this should be a system property. That is the correct way.

CLOUD_OPTS should be reserved for exceptional cases when there is no other option in the field.

Can we add in some recommended multicast address ranges to either use or try?  Or even ones to avoid?  

This is great to know, because I suspect I've been seeing this in the field more frequently than I'd like.

Hey [~lrich],

Per the [Cisco IP Multicast Address Overview|http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/ios/solutions_docs/ip_multicast/White_papers/mcst_ovr.html#wp1008680], the range that has given us issues is the range labeled _Globally Scoped Addresses_.  The range for _Globally Scoped Addresses_ is as follows:  224.0.1.0 to 238.255.255.255.  The range that most data centers allow multicast traffic is called _Limited (or Administratively) Scope Addresses_.  The range for _Limited Scope Addresses_ is as follows:  239.0.0.0/8.  By default, Eucalyptus uses 228.7.7.3.  This IP can be changed by using the information above to an address in the _Limited Scope Address_ range by changing 228.7.7.3 to 239.7.7.3 and it should be good to go.  As always, confirmation with the Networking Team should be confirmed before changing the multicast address.  Hope this helps.
When is this coming to our docs? Just trying to understand when will it say the day of the light if you will.

Pulling all VMware related issues together - assigning to me for review/closure. 
DOC-1566 is the main issue - removing deprecated VMware from the docs.
Sorry, [~scottb] should not have reassigned this ticket. Not VMware specific. Back to you. kjm

Note that DOC-1777 shows the new method of setting multicast address - 

EUCA-11979 (4.3.0) adds a new configuration option that we should document for changing the multicast address:

{code}
CLOUD_OPTS="--mcast-addr=228.7.7.3"
{code}

The above shows how to set the multicast address to a value compatible with previous releases.

This is now the approach we should document rather than as mentioned above.

[~sjones] I have updated the description above (changed default multicast address, changed cloud_opts command to update it, added note, removed VMware reference). Not sure if the 2nd bit is still needed (setup_membership.groovy). Is it? Please correct as needed. thanks! kjm
[~kmeredith], setup_membership.groovy should not be modified, the CLOUD_OPTS change is all that is necessary for setting the address in 4.3.

Thanks [~sjones] updated the description to remove setup_membership.groovy bit.

See the new section:
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#security-guide/multicast_modify.html
(added to security tasks section rather than the suggested best practices concepts section)

Further updates to the intro - we changed the multicast address so that we do not use the globally-scoped multicast address range by default.

Also updated the new topic.

[~tony] please QA the following doc also when QA'ing EUCA-11979 / EUCA-8371
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#security-guide/multicast_modify.html
[~mclark] ping - can I assume no issues here?
Changing the port(s) used for web services will not impact the ports used for multicast.
Thanks. Is it accurate and/or of value in this section to say the admin needs to open up mulitcast addr for just port 8773?
Added a postreq about checking the firewall. Will appear in midnight doc build.
Calling this one good. Thanks all.
